article:
Centuries ago a great artist was engaged to paint a picture for the main church in a Sicilian town. The   _  was the life of Christ. For many
years the artist worked hard, and finally the painting was finished  _  for the two most important figures: Jesus and Judas Iscariot  .
  One day while walking in the city, he   came upon  some children playing in the street. Among
them was a 12-year-old boy whose  _  excited the
painter. The artist took the child home with him, and day after day the boy sat  _  until the face of the Jesus was finished.  _  the painter still had found no  _  model
for the portrait of Judas.
  The story of the unfinished picture   _  widely, and many men,  _  themselves as
the model of Judas,  _  to help the artist, but  in vain  . And the old painter continued to look for Judas, who he expected to be a
man, changed by life, and  _  by greed and lust  .
  The one afternoon while he was sitting in a restaurant, a poor and thin   _  appeared
at the door. "Wine, wine," he  _  . Greatly excited,
the old painter thought he had found the suitable  _  and
said, "Come with me, and I will give you wine." For many days the painter
worked excitedly to  _  his picture. As the work
went on, something like  _  came over the model.
A strange feeling  _  the tiredness. And his
bloodshot   eyes were filled with   _  . The painter paused in his
work. "My son," he said, "what troubles you so?"
  The man   _  his
face in his hands, sobbing. After a long while he lifted his pleading eyes to
the old painter's face. "Don't you remember me? Years ago I was your model for
Jesus."
